Lead.t: Responsible for the overall organisation and running of the event.

Volunteer Coordinator.t: Recruits and assigns the volunteer team. Registers volunteers, issues food vouchers and supervises race control on the day.

Asst. Coordinator.t: Assistant to race and volunteer leads.

Safety Officer.t: Reviews and refines safety procdedures. Manages any issues on the day.

Race Briefings.t: Pre-race briefings to all competitors. Covers PA announcements during the race.

Referee.t: British Triathlon approved race referee. Reviews safety and organisation, advises lead, volunteers and competitors to ensure BTF rules are understood and followed. Produces post-event BTF report.

Motor Cycle Marshall.t: Monitors adult cycle course. Safety and rule advice to competitors, reporting any incidents

Lead.t: Lead site team. Work with swim team to fine-tune queue. Ensure smooth and safe flow of competitors through site.

Swim Bridge.t: Manage flow of competitors to swim. Communicate with pool entry advising briefing and PA to accelerate or slow flow of compeetitors as needed.

Art Centre.t: Ensure car park only used by Art Centre customers and race officials. Direct competitors to local road parking.

Spectator Bridge.t: Route to registration and transition for spectators, volunteers and competitors.

Competitor Bridge.t: Manage flow of competitors over bridge keeping swimmers and cyclists apart. Direct non-competitors to spectator bridge.

Lead.t: Heads up the team, also performing a registration role.

Registration.t: Registers competitors using app and provide numbers and timing chips. Directs competitors to marker and foot protectors.

Marker.t: Write number on left arm. Advise competitors of need to use foot protectors to keep feet clean.

Lead.t: Lead swim team. Ensure smooth and safe flow of competitors through swim. Consider improvements for future years.

Pool Entry.t: Manage swim queue. Discuss swim ability to allocate competitor to appropriate lane. Ensure clean feet and correct fitting of timing chips.

Starter.t: Manage swim lane starts. Brief competitors on start, required lengths, resting, overtaking and finishing process.

Lap Counter.t: Count swim laps (paired counters for cross-check). Know categories and laps. Submerge board to signal final 2 lengths.

Pool Exit.t: Guide competitors out of the pool and towards transition. Warn to take care with step.

Lead.t: Lead cycle team focussing attention on any evolving safety concerns.

Mount/Dismount.name: Manage cyclist Mount/Dismount line. Prevent early mounting and late dismounting. Adult course is 3 laps.

Morrison Roundabout.t: Ensure safe flow of cyclists over Morrison Roundabout.

King George Roundabout.t: Direct safe left turn at roundabout.

King George Lights.t: Busy left turn at lights onto Headstone Lane. Traffic risk - ensure cyclists are safe and follow the correct route.

Headstone Width Restrict.t: Traffic risk at width restriction. Ensure cyclists maximise safety, which may or may not involve use of the cycle/bus lane.

Headstone Zebra Crossing.t: Ensure zebra crossing safety is observed.

Headstone/Uxbridge Left.t: Final left turn of lap. Ensure cyclists are safe and follow the correct route.

Cycle Sign Removal.t: Remove signs from adult cycle course after last competitor has finished.

Junior Course.t: Manage junior off-road course. Ensure competitors are safe and follow the correct route, keeping clear of runners.

Lead.t: Lead team and perform run marshall role.

Start.t: Direct to run route after cycle.

Lap Bands.t: Issue wrist bands at lap 1/2 way point. Know number colours and required laps. Advise on laps remaining if required.

Marshall.t: Direct lap or towards finish at end of final lap. Know number colours and required laps.

Water.t: Marshall and distribute bottle water to running competitors as required.

Medals.t: Issue medals and water to finishers. Collect timing chips.

Lead.t: Lead transition team, ensuring bike safety and security, efficient racking of bikes and safe competitor flow.

Marshall.t: Assist competitors as required (juniors in particular). Ensure bikes are racked correctly and safely and help competitors with transition entry and exit routes.

Lead.t: Enables youth race to immediately follow adults. Also acts as youth marshall or mount/dismount.

Mount/Dismount.t: Manage change to youth transition and Mount/Dismount while adults still finishing.

Marshall.t: Particular care where adult run course and junior cycle course are close.
